intro: Securidaca erecta, commonly known as the African coffee tree, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Papaveraceae. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its erect, branching habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and savanna habitats. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
